title: How I Built a DevOps Dashboard on AWS EC2
content: This project started as a way to understand how real servers behave in production.
I launched an Ubuntu EC2 instance and configured security groups properly.
Instead of using node server.js, I used PM2 for process management.
Nginx was configured as a reverse proxy from port 80 to 3000.
Later, I containerized the app using Docker and faced real port binding issues which taught me practical networking.

title: Common Docker Port Binding Mistakes and Fixes
content: Docker port conflicts are one of the most common beginner issues.
I repeatedly saw 'port already allocated' errors while running containers.
The issue was old containers and host services occupying the port.
Learning to debug with docker ps, docker stop, and lsof was crucial.
